sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: In this video, I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and we’re diving into vector equations. This concept lets us rewrite systems of equations using vectors — a game changer for understanding geometry and linear algebra visually.

sections.title: What Is a Vector Equation?
sections.content: A vector equation expresses a system of equations as a linear combination of vectors. Instead of writing equations line by line, we treat them like weighted vectors added together to produce another vector.

sections.title: Why Vector Form Matters
sections.content: In vector form, solving a system means finding weights (x and y) to scale and add vectors to land exactly on a target vector. This gives us powerful visual and computational tools.

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We took a system of equations and rephrased it using vector equations. This lets us visualize and solve systems in terms of vector addition — a key step toward understanding span, linear independence, and transformations.
